intro: Caraipa longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stalked caraipa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
